Get Fourier coefficients

Source: R/utils_efourier.R
efourier_coefs.Rd

Extracts the Fourier coefficients from objects computed with efourier() and efourier_norm() returning a 'ready-to-analyze' data frame.

Usage

efourier_coefs(x)

Arguments

x

An object computed with efourier() or efourier_norm().

Value

A data.frame object

Examples

library(pliman)

# a list of objects
efourier(contours) |> efourier_coefs()
#>   object         A1         A2         A3         A4         A5         A6
#> 1      1  -26.81446  -1.020677  -5.101594 -0.6044017  -1.737430  0.5477908
#> 2      2 -446.11163  -5.077747 -41.457959 -2.8494414 -14.470822 -0.5854536

# one object, normalized coefficients
efourier(contours[[4]]) |>
  efourier_norm() |>
  efourier_coefs()
#>              an            bn            cn            dn
#> 1   1.000000000  1.853479e-17  9.267394e-18 -0.9514067664
#> 2  -0.019954383 -3.957299e-01  1.047938e-01 -0.0202869737
#> 3  -0.002321877 -2.216469e-04  3.269770e-02  0.3357663692
#> 4  -0.021985444 -1.195120e-01 -6.884594e-02 -0.0001935063
#> 5  -0.009614050 -1.523015e-03  1.496870e-02  0.0491334898
#> 6  -0.026121940 -9.969463e-02  4.060766e-02 -0.0037886893
